juzzyPython.intervalType2.system.IT2_Rule module

IT2_Rule.py Created 14/1/2022

class juzzyPython.intervalType2.system.IT2_Rule.IT2_Rule(antecedents: List[juzzyPython.intervalType2.system.IT2_Antecedent.IT2_Antecedent], consequent: Optional[juzzyPython.intervalType2.system.IT2_Consequent.IT2_Consequent] = None, consequents: Optional[List[juzzyPython.intervalType2.system.IT2_Consequent.IT2_Consequent]] = None)[source]

Bases: object

Class IT2_Rule Rule class for Interval Type-2 FLSs. Note that currently only a single consequent per rule is supported.

Parameters

  • Antecedents – The array of antecedents

  • Consequent – The consequent (only a single consequent is supported here)

  • Consequents – The array of consequents

Functions:

getNumberOfAntecedents getNumberOfConsequents getAntecedents getConsequents getInputs compareBasedOnAntecedents getFStrength toString getConsequentCentroid

compareBasedOnAntecedents(r: juzzyPython.intervalType2.system.IT2_Rule.IT2_Rule) → bool[source]

Performs a comparison operation by comparing the rule objects solely based on their antecedents. The method returns true of the antecedents of both rules are the same.

getAntecedents() → List[juzzyPython.intervalType2.system.IT2_Antecedent.IT2_Antecedent][source]

Return the list of antecedents

Return the consequent centroid of the ouput

getConsequents() → List[juzzyPython.intervalType2.system.IT2_Consequent.IT2_Consequent][source]

Return the list of consequents

getFStrength(tNorm: int) → float[source]

Returns the rule’s firing strength. The method relies on the transparent updating of the inputs of the fuzzy system through the Input classes attached to the antecedents.

getInputs() → List[juzzyPython.generic.Input.Input][source]

Return the list of inputs

Return the number of antecedents

getNumberOfConsequents() → int[source]

Return the number of consequents

IT2_Rulebase.py Created 16/1/2022

class juzzyPython.intervalType2.system.IT2_Rulebase.IT2_Rulebase[source]

Bases: object

Class IT2_Rulebase Keeps track of rules and generates results

Parameters

set (initialNumberOfRules = Starting rules for the logic) –

Functions:

getInputs getFuzzyLogicType addRule addRules getRules getNumberOfRules evaluateGetCentroid evaluate doCOSTypeReduction getFiringIntervalsForCOS_TR doReductionCentroid weightedSigma removeRule setImplicationMethod getImplicationMethod getOutputs toString

addRule(r: juzzyPython.intervalType2.system.IT2_Rule.IT2_Rule) → None[source]

Add a new rule to the rule set

addRules(r: List[juzzyPython.intervalType2.system.IT2_Rule.IT2_Rule]) → None[source]

Add multiple new rules to the rule set

doCOSTypeReduction() → dict[source]

Reduce based on center of sets reduction type

doReductionCentroid() → dict[source]

Do reduction based on the centroid type

evaluate(typeReductionType: int) → dict[source]

Returns typereduced & defuzzified result of evaluating all rules in the rulebase. typeReductionType: The type of type reducer to be used: 0-Center-Of-Sets, 1-Centroid. discretizationLevel: The discretization level to be employed (only applies to centroid type reducer) return The type-reduced and defuzzified output.

evaluateGetCentroid(typeReductionType: int) → dict[source]

Returns the output of the FLS after type-reduction, i.e. the centroid. return A TreeMap where Output is used as key and the value is an Object[] where Object[0] is a Tuple (the centroid) and Object[1] is a Double holding the associated yValue for the centroid. If not rule fired for the given input(s), then null is returned as an Object[].

getFiringIntervalsForCOS_TR() → dict[source]

Get the firing intervals for cos type reduction

getFuzzyLogicType() → int[source]

Returns the type of fuzzy logic that is employed. return 0: type-1, 1: interval type-2, 2: zSlices based general type-2

getImplicationMethod() → str[source]

Return if the implication is product or minimum

getInputs() → List[juzzyPython.generic.Input.Input][source]

This method assumes all rules use the same (and all) inputs. The first rule is queried to identify the inputs and return them. return An array of the inputs used in the rulebase (retrieved from the actecedents of the firts rule in the rulebase!)

getNumberOfRules() → int[source]

Get the number of rules in the set

getOutputs() → List[juzzyPython.generic.Output.Output][source]

Return list of outputs

getRules() → List[juzzyPython.intervalType2.system.IT2_Rule.IT2_Rule][source]

Return all the rules in the set

removeRule(ruleNumber: int) → None[source]

Remove a rule based on its index

setImplicationMethod(implicationMethod: int) → None[source]

Set the product or minimum implication method

toString() → str[source]

Convert the class to string

Return the sigma based on COS inference data
